Key Match Events: Bangladesh lost the match by 4 runs
Jaker Ali was caught on the straight boundary trying to hit the winning six
Taskin Ahmed overturned an lbw decision on review but the runs had already been struck off
Tanzim Hasan Sakib dismissed Quinton de Kock lbw and Reeza Hendricks for a golden duck
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh deserved better, especially Towhid Hridoy who had held everything together with his fine 37
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the second-biggest crowd Bangladesh had at Long Island during the tournament
The number of Bangladeshi-Americans living in New York has tripled in the past decade
Others: South Africa's innings was a wreck
Bangladesh played one of the better games any team have turned in at the Nassau County ground
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller batted through the next 14 overs together and put on a match-winning 75
Taskin Ahmed bowled Markram with a delivery that moved just enough off the pitch
South Africa, who have a reputation for losing games they ought to win, seem to be winning all the ones they ought to lose
